alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 17 at 7:27PM MST until July 17 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 815 PM MST. * At 727 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Florence Junction to 9 miles east of Magma to near Florence to near Coolidge, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 202 and 219. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 134 and 135. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 129 and 150. Locations impacted include... Apache Junction, Florence, Coolidge, Gold Canyon, Queen Creek, Blackwater, Magma, San Tan Valley, Coolidge Airport, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, San Tan Mountain Park, Gold Camp and Valley Farms. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
